what: Adding new mobility models to nomad
title: Data
text: new mobility data sets generated, users wish easily share resultant mobility models wider community can easily add nomad. ensure consistency nomad ensure data transparancy reproducibility, please follow steps wanted later edit one datasets, ’s workflow look like:

previous_headings: Adding new mobility models to nomad
title: Data
text: Fork nomad repository make new branch Go data-raw/ add new row mobility_db.csv describe new mobility data set Run mobility_db_load.R script generate mobility_db R object Save new data catalogue object usethis::use_data(mobility_db, overwrite = TRUE).

previous_headings: Adding new mobility models to nomad
what: Add your mobility model to nomad
title: Data
text: Open R/data.R add additional entry new mobility model. help adding entry, please look previous entries example: last line name nomad::model now need create, e.g. see function call, similar data.R entry. Importantly, model_name argument used help nomad link model extra information provided mobility_db.csv allow nomad helper functions present users longer descriptions. model exist internal database (still adding want ), model_desc data_desc fiels provide minimal set information users may share model fit objet model generated. Now generated model, add nomad: Run devtool::document() put changes effect. Run Check good measure devtools::check(document=FALSE) finally… Go Build > Install Restart (Ctrl+Shift+B) Commit changes push changes fork Github Make pull request new model
code: #' Zambia 2020 Call Data Records Exponential Departure-Diffusion Model #' #' Mobility model generated using [mobility::mobility()] based on call data #' records collected in Zambia in 2020 The mobility model is an exponential #' Departure-Diffusion model. #' #' For full metadata of the CDR data, please see `?nomad::mobility_db` #' #' @format A `nomad::model` class object #' @source \url{https://elifesciences.org/articles/68441} "zambia_cdr_2020_mod_dd_exp" zambia_cdr_2020_mod_dd_exp <- nomad::nmd_model(   model = zambia_cdr_2020_mod_dd_exp,   model_desc = "Zambia 2020 Call Data Records Exponential Departure-Diffusion Model",   data_desc = "Zambia 2020 Call Data Records",   model_name = "zambia_cdr_2020_mod_dd_exp" ) usethis::use_data(zambia_cdr_2020_mod_dd_exp)

title: Package Structure
text: overall structure nomad package, details different components (models, underlying data, population hepers etc). package components shown : ### 1. Models main workhorse R6 mobility model class. class store mobility models, include functionality mobility model (prediction new data, use destination probability prediction etc), providing additional functionality help users: Show model performance data used fitting Descriptions model type Description data set used fitting (links data catalogue) Reproducibility caching stochastic draws Models stored nomad users apply research need. help users identify best model needs, nomad also maintains data catalogue different mobility data sets used producing mobility models available nomad.

title: Package Structure
text: data catalgoue structure data set (format undecided yet) storing meta data mobility data set used create mobility models. meta data (mobility data survey size, sampling scheme, respondent characteristics, location, associated publication, date survey, description data censoring aggregation, etc) help guide users understand data source seems suitable use case. example, end users may want choose mobility models fit using data country analysis, may want select based mobility data type (flight data, travel surveys etc). facilitate need, nomad provides functionality query visualise mobility data: Maps data locations Visualisations survey sizes … users identified suitable data sets, can identify associated model objects fits data sets.

title: Package Structure
text: End users likely approach nomad location data (lat/long, shape files, distance matrices etc) possibly linked population data. help users get data format needed mobility models well help provide interpretation reproducibility analyses, provide series helper functions nomad: API tools population data sets (WorldPop) Conversion population rasters shape files Plotting visualisation outputs mobility models Lastly, provide suppoting vignettes guides give demonstration full functionality, relationship mobility package well users mobility data can use mobility fit mobility models integrate nomad either submitting new PRs, converting mobility model one can leverage nomad functionality.

title: Package Structure
text: Tool creating ensemble mobility models (predicting multiple models appropriate weights based user needs) Interactive tool demonstrating difference model predictions linking ensemble (widget slider different weights) Vignette demonstrate select model use. Possible ideas include simulating dummy infectious disease spatial model identifying best model best goodness fit based different mobility models, fixing everything else. PRs mobility custom model specification
